flow.descriptionCdata:
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.00f251ab-d4b6-42fa-b2ac-b40a392471e7.description=Replaces a substring within a string. 
Inputs\:
input - the master string.
replace - the text to replace.
replaceWith - the text to replace with.

Results\:
the string with the text replaced.

Responses\:
success - succeeded in updating string.
failure - was unable to replace for some reason
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.05865c55-e88d-424a-94c7-2a8f451d8145.description=
This operation encodes a clear string into a Base64-encoded string.

Inputs\:
    data - The data string that need to be encoded in base64 encoding. 
Examples\: ファイル読む書く, hello. 

    characterSet - The character encoding used for the data string. If you do not specify a value for this input, it uses the system's default character encoding which depends on the RAS system.
Examples\: UTF-8, ISO-8859-1, US-ASCII or Shift_JIS.

Results\:
    returnResult - The encoded data string in Base64 encoding.  For example,  44OV44Kh44Kk44Or6Kqt44KA5pu444GP, aGVsbG8\= which corresponds to the data input examples.  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully. 
    failure - The operation failed.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.06629c1c-1e14-4e16-99ab-94f45b507d41.prompt=Value\: 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.07e28048-5bd2-4c67-862d-d2545e033ee7.callout=Check if Authentication is provided 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.0aa8d17b-96be-4cb4-b34a-8b1035f4885f.description=
 
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable. 
    trimSpaces - If set on "true" then all the whitespaces will be removed from the value stored. 
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false

Returns\: 
    The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable with all whitespaces removed.

Responses\:
    isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
    notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned. 

Notes\: 
    1. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "true" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "isNull". 
    2. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "false" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "notNull". 
    3. If any other value than "true" or "false" is passed on "trimSpaces" input then the default value (false) will be used.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.0b43cbb0-6ec4-46b6-ae2e-491551e2a0a5.callout=Make JS File Remote on Linux 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.0c0704bb-3425-4021-8cfe-6e24308c2617.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.133193dc-4f59-4cee-be2d-c008c8623c84.description=
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ) need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
password - Password of the user.
outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
currentDirectory - Current directory.
characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation (for instance\: ibm437, shift_jis).  Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  The default value is the default encoding of the RAS.
outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.  Examples of valid inputs include\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16.
timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional.  After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.  the default value is 600.

Responses\:
success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
failure - Unable to start remote process.

Extra Results\:
ReturnValue - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
ProcessID - The process id of the remote process.
ProcessReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
StdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
StdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)
ibm775		Baltic (DOS)
ibm850		Western European (DOS)
ibm852		Central European (DOS)
IBM855		OEM Cyrillic
ibm857		Turkish (DOS)
IBM00858		OEM Multilingual Latin I
IBM860		Portuguese (DOS)
ibm861		Icelandic (DOS)
DOS-862		Hebrew (DOS)
IBM863		French Canadian (DOS)
IBM864		Arabic (864)
IBM865		Nordic (DOS)
cp866		Cyrillic (DOS)
ibm869		Greek, Modern (DOS)
shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)
gb2312		Chinese Simplified (GB2312)
ks_c_5601-1987	Korean
big5		Chinese Traditional (Big5)
utf-16		Unicode
unicodeFFFE		Unicode (Big-Endian)
utf-7		Unicode (UTF-7)
utf-8		Unicode (UTF-8)
utf-32		Unicode (UTF-32)
utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.1c319090-16c4-4ebc-a504-ca0ba2cd4ccc.callout=Make JS File Remote on Windows 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.24ea7481-d8dd-4c15-a4fa-0d64f4354078.description=Replaces a substring within a string. 
Inputs\:
input - the master string.
replace - the text to replace.
replaceWith - the text to replace with.

Results\:
the string with the text replaced.

Responses\:
success - succeeded in updating string.
failure - was unable to replace for some reason
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.27e7ba42-99e7-4488-83b7-ae81c50f673e.transition.description=is Linux/Unix 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.428e4043-2da2-4e12-b8e9-aa9545a12149.callout=Replace Parameters 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.4a347a3f-ca9b-416e-b3e9-d8c75c1f7c8e.prompt=Value\: 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.67261684-bbd2-4421-ad02-75ea72a75c25.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.7a93bb3f-d506-4960-90ed-5eb7254d5ee4.description=
Runs an SSH command

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address.
port - The port number for running the command. It overwrites the port given inside the host input -in a syntax like host\:port-, if this exists.
command - The command to execute.
arguments - The arguments to pass to the command.
pty - Whether to use pty (true, false. Default is false).
privateKeyFile - Path to private key file, relative to ICONCLUDE_HOME on the RAS.
username - Username to connect as.
password - Password of user. If using a private key file this will be used as the passphrase for the file.
timeout - Time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete (optional, default 90 seconds).
characterSet - The characterSet name for input stream encoding from the target machine. For example, SJIS, EUC-JP, UTF-8.  By default it is UTF-8. 
closeSession - Close SSH session at completion of this operation (true, false)? If false the ssh session will be cached for future calls of this operation during the life of the flow. If true the ssh session used by this operation will be closed. Default is true.

Responses\:
success - The command was executed successfully.
failure - The command could not be executed.

Extra Results\:
STDERR - The STDERR of the command.
STDOUT - The STDOUT of the command.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.7ed624f8-374d-48c8-9190-43d648f99d04.description=Replaces a substring within a string. 
Inputs\:
input - the master string.
replace - the text to replace.
replaceWith - the text to replace with.

Results\:
the string with the text replaced.

Responses\:
success - succeeded in updating string.
failure - was unable to replace for some reason
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.82d94c2a-e373-4dbf-b32c-b572de9da9d3.prompt=The init.d startup script name for the HAP node app. 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.89b4a5c4-5a03-4494-982f-f67260db1734.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.905a8a8b-429a-41fa-a895-d87162739668.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.9bd6add8-fd8f-42fe-8d50-daf7d32d6239.prompt=Value\: 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.a266885d-95ce-42bc-9d73-c7ea7b9d1efe.description=Replaces a substring within a string.

47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.a815f919-8bbd-4826-85ca-a1750c266a5b.prompt=Enter trigger username\: Username format\: 1A\:2B\:3C\:4D\:5E\:FF This should be unique, if not, it will not be discoverable 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.b4939f0c-486d-4d02-88f9-9a39133890cc.prompt=For an accessory to be discoverable, it is required to restart hap server. Set this input to True if you want to restart the server after an accessory was added. (This option works only for Linux if the startup script was set-up before) 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.b5f699f2-334f-484d-8179-ac652fbb3922.description=
This operation adds a flow variable to the local context. The variable is available in the current flow and its child flows.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The name of the flow variable to add.
    myValue - The value to assign to the flow variable.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of "myValue" input field.

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.

Note\:
   If a flow variable with the same name already exists, its value will be overwritten.
47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.bc92e5e0-2ad2-4c50-8ecb-f91be3312aaa.description=
Uses WMI to attempt to create a remote process on a machine.  The command passed should be formatted as though it was run on the command line.

CAUTION\: internally 'cmd /c' gets prepended to the command passed.  Also '2>tempfile 1>tempfile' get appended to the command so that we can attempt to capture stdout and stderr.
So your command will look like this when executed\:
	'cmd /c [yourcommand] 2>temperr 1>tempout'

Inputs\:
host - Hostname or ip address of the target machine.
command - The command you want executed. Special characters\: <, >, (, ) need to be escaped using the caret (^) character.  The only exception to this rule is when the > character is used to redirect output.
user - Username to use for remote WMI impersonation and thread impersonation on the RAS host for this operation (can be left blank).
password - Password of the user.
outputPath - Network accessible path used by the operation to store temporary files. If not specified it points to \\host\admin$\temp\'. If this path is not accessible you should change it to use another share that the host local system account has write access to. By default the path will have to be changed on Windows 2000 systems.
currentDirectory - Current directory.
characterSet - The character encoding used to write the batch file that will be remotely executed by the operation (for instance\: ibm437, shift_jis).  Unicode character encodings may not supported for this input (utf-8, utf-16, etc.).  Support for unicode encodings depends on target system capabilities.  By default this encoding will also be used to read the command output that is redirected to temporary files.  If the command output is expected to be of different encoding, specify the different encoding in the outputCharacterSet input.  The default value is the default encoding of the RAS.
outputCharacterSet - The character encoding used to read the command output that was redirected to temporary files.  Only need to specify this input if the output of the command is known to output a different character encoding.  As an example\: the 'wmic' command returns utf-16 encoded output.  Examples of valid inputs include\: ibm437, shift_jis, utf-8, utf-16.
timeout - The number of seconds before assuming the remote process is no longer functional.  After the timeout has expired the remote process and all child processes will be terminated.  the default value is 600.

Responses\:
success - Remote process successfully launched and has completed executing.
failure - Unable to start remote process.

Extra Results\:
ReturnValue - Return value from WMI for starting the process (not the exit value of the process).
ProcessID - The process id of the remote process.
ProcessReturnCode - The return code of the remote process.
StdOut - Standard output from the remote process.
StdErr - Standard error from the remote process.

Notes\: 
List of possible encoding names (Support for the encoding may depend on the version or language of the RAS OS)\:

Encoding Name\:	Description\:
IBM437		OEM United States
DOS-720		Arabic (DOS)
ibm737		Greek (DOS)
ibm775		Baltic (DOS)
ibm850		Western European (DOS)
ibm852		Central European (DOS)
IBM855		OEM Cyrillic
ibm857		Turkish (DOS)
IBM00858		OEM Multilingual Latin I
IBM860		Portuguese (DOS)
ibm861		Icelandic (DOS)
DOS-862		Hebrew (DOS)
IBM863		French Canadian (DOS)
IBM864		Arabic (864)
IBM865		Nordic (DOS)
cp866		Cyrillic (DOS)
ibm869		Greek, Modern (DOS)
shift_jis		Japanese (Shift-JIS)
gb2312		Chinese Simplified (GB2312)
ks_c_5601-1987	Korean
big5		Chinese Traditional (Big5)
utf-16		Unicode
unicodeFFFE		Unicode (Big-Endian)
utf-7		Unicode (UTF-7)
utf-8		Unicode (UTF-8)
utf-32		Unicode (UTF-32)
utf-32BE		Unicode (UTF-32 Big-Endian)
Johab		Korean (Johab)
us-ascii		US-ASCII
koi8-r		Cyrillic (KOI8-R)
euc-jp		Japanese (EUC)
EUC-CN		Chinese Simplified (EUC)
euc-kr		Korean (EUC)
hz-gb-2312		Chinese Simplified (HZ)
GB18030		Chinese Simplified (GB18030)

47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.fc691ab9-6842-474f-bca0-c6bf609e1ac7.transition.description=is Windows 47bd7749-ed2a-48ad-a51e-a75057162da3.fee125b8-d00c-45fe-833b-66cd8b254cf9.description=
 
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
    keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable. 
    trimSpaces - If set on "true" then all the whitespaces will be removed from the value stored. 
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false

Returns\: 
    The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable with all whitespaces removed.

Responses\:
    isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
    notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned. 

Notes\: 
    1. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "true" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "isNull". 
    2. If the "trimSpaces" input is set on "false" and the value from "keyName" contains only whitespaces then the response will be "notNull". 
    3. If any other value than "true" or "false" is passed on "trimSpaces" input then the default value (false) will be used.
flow.name: createAccessoryFromTemplatewithServerRestart

scriptlet.name: Step Create JS Accessory in Flow createAccessoryFromTemplatewithServerRestart (0c0704bb-3425-4021-8cfe-6e24308c2617)
